results.title: Shadows and fog
results.brief_description: The circus comes to town and fog covers a small European town as the locals, gripped by fear, band together to form vigilante groups to rid themselves of a strangler at large. Woody Allen plays a timid and fearful man who has been roped into one of the vigilante groups to find that he spends his time haplessly pitted against each faction within the vigilantes. A comedy of errors, ‘Shadows and Fog’ draws on its A-grade hollywood cast to create almost a disintegration of film epitomised by the bumbling incompetencies of Allen’s character who wanders alongide the main action like a narrator. The more the film follows Allen’s character the further we digress into a world of iconic noir references whilst quietly accompanied by some of Allen’s best gags. Cast includes Mia Farrow, John Malkovich, Donald Pleasence, Lily Tomlin, John Cusack, Jodie Foster, Kathy Bates, Fred Gwynne, Madonna and Woody Allen.

results.title: Shadows
results.creator_credit: Cassavetes, McEndree, Cassel Productions, Maurice McEndree and John Cassavetes
results.brief_description: ‘Shadows’ was a vanguard work of the independent American cinema, a bittersweet comedy centred on three African-American outsiders - Lelia and his two jazz-musicians brothers living in Greenwich Village - two of whom pass for white and all are part of the late fifties ‘lost generation’. We follow Lelia through three brief romantic involvements. Although the film was recognised at the time for its treatment of race, Cassavetes saw this as incidental to the wider question of identity. His special commitment to expression through performance and a concomitant openness of form give his films a rough, uninflected, anecdotal quality (a form of ‘fictional cinema verite’). ‘Shadows’, like other Cassavetes’ films was fully scripted despite the reference in the end title to the film as ‘an improvisation’. Cast includes Lelia Goldoni, Ben Carruthers, Hugh Hurd.

results.title: Shadowlands
results.creator_credit: Spelling Films International, Richard Attenborough and Brian Eastman
results.brief_description:
Shadowlands is an absorbing and moving story of true love. British writer C. S. Lewis, whose comfortable but rigid life as an Oxford don in the 1950’s is shaken by his meeting with a forthright poet, American Joy Gresham. She knew him from his books and he remembered her from her letters, but when they finally met, she was unlike any-one he had ever known. Like his writings, his love for Joy is captivating and magical. A story for everyone, made with uncommon intelligence and restraint.
Cast includes: Anthony Hopkins, Debra Winger and Julian Fellowes

results.title: Sexy beast
results.creator_credit: Fox Searchlight Pictures, Film Four International, Kanzaman S A, Jeremy Thomas and Jonathan Glazer
results.brief_description: Gary (Ray Winstone) is a retired criminal, living in a luxurious Spanish villa with his ex-porn star wife and a couple of choice friends. The news of the impending arrival of Don (Ben Kingsley) - a former colleague of Don’s and a psychopath, puts the group on knife-edge. Don descends on the group like a hurricane - spewing foul language and oozing menace. His mission is to bring Gary back to London for a jewellery heist, masterminded by Teddy Bass (Ian MacShane). Gary’s refusal means little to Don as he cajoles, threatens, prods and manipulates Gary into taking the job. Don also works on intimidating the group, who are catatonic with fear and are on a helpless mission not to evoke Don’s anger. “Sexy beast” is a thriller/crime film that has a kinetic style that is at times reminiscent of Guy Ritchie. This film was Jonathon Glazer’s debut feature and Ben Kingsley was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Actor.

results.title: Sex, lies and videotape
results.creator_credit: Outlaw Productions, Robert Newmyer, John Hardy and Steven Soderbergh
results.brief_description: A selfish, successful lawyer (Peter Gallagher) - whose wife (Andie MacDowell) has been turned off sex is having an affair with his sister-in-law (Laura San Giacomo). He welcomes an old college friend (James Spader) for a visit, not realising the amazing effect that he will have on all of them. A finely honed tale of adultery, impotence and dangerous liaisons. Strong women, weak men; a quartet defined by their erotic impulses and inhibitions. This is Steven Soderbergh’s first feature, and it won him Best Film and James Spader Best Actor at the Cannes Film Festival in 1989.

results.title: Sex and Lucia = Lucia y el sexo
results.creator_credit: Sogecine, Alicia Produce, Canal+ Espana, Fernando Bovaira, Enrique Lopez Lavigne and Julio Medem
results.brief_description: Lucia’s life and her past merge when she is shocked by the death of her lover, a writer. Seeking answers to his death, she travels to an island idyll where she remembers but also makes new connections to a couple who have a past with her now dead partner. Visually stunning and erotically charged, this film is not just about sex but a search for truth, love and living life to the full. This arresting film by the maker of “Tierra” and “The Red Squirrel” is edgy, luscious and hot. Cast includes Paz Vega, Tristan Ulloa, Najwa Nimri, Daniel Freire. Warning: contains full frontal nudity and sex scenes. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Sex & Zen (E)
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Johnny Mak Production Ltd, Johnny Mak and Michael Mak
results.brief_description: Based on the book “The Carnal prayer mat” which was banned for 400 years, this is a bawdy tale of the sexual adventures of a monk during the Ming Dynasty. Sexually explicit, this is considered to be on of China’s greatest erotic sagas. Cantonese dialogue with English subtitles. NOTE: At times the subtitles are difficult to read, this is due to the way the print has been filmed.

results.title: Seven years in Tibet (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Reperage and Vanguard Films, Applecross Productions, Jean-Jacques Annaud, John H. Williams and Iain Smith
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Austrian climber Heinrich Harrer, this is the amazing true story of his friendship with the Dalai Lama. Climbing in the Himalayas, Harrer is captured as a POW in China at the start of the second world war. He manages to escape the camp and flees across the mountains into isolated Tibet. As one of the few foreigners to ever enter Tibet, Harrer forms a friendship with the young Dalai Lama and becomes his confidante. The film depicts the most tumultuous period of Tibetan history in which China invades and occupies Tibet - an oppression which continues to this day.
